page.title: 02General description cont.
page.content: The underlying rock of this area is a coarse sandstone known locally as gritstone.From its upper reaches drain a considerable number of streams mainly in a westerly or south westerly direction,whose valley sides are very steep. The whole area is dominated by sheep farming with just a dozen or so scattered and isolated farmsteads, being responsible for the entire area. It is therefore an area of extremely sparse population and, as it contains no major manufacturing industries,is not intruded upon by primary lines of communication, nor has it any of the amenities of city, town or village,it is an area of peace and tranquility, absolutely free from all forms of pollution.
